kamakhya-temple.name: Kamakhya Temple
kamakhya-temple.summary: One of the 51 Shakti Peethas, this ancient temple atop Nilachal Hill is a major pilgrimage site and center of Tantric worship.

manas-national-park.name: Manas National Park
manas-national-park.summary: UNESCO World Heritage Site and Project Tiger reserve, home to tigers, elephants, rhinos and the rare golden langur.

assam-state-museum.name: Assam State Museum
assam-state-museum.summary: Showcases Assam's rich cultural heritage with artifacts, sculptures, manuscripts, and traditional costumes.

chakradhara-temple-hajo.name: Chakradhara Temple (Hajo)
chakradhara-temple-hajo.summary: Sacred pilgrimage site for Hindus, Buddhists and Muslims, believed to be where Lord Buddha attained Nirvana.

sualkuchi.name: Sualkuchi
sualkuchi.summary: Known as the 'Manchester of Assam', this weaving village is famous for producing exquisite Muga and Pat silk.

tawang-monastery.name: Tawang Monastery
tawang-monastery.summary: India's largest Buddhist monastery and the second largest in the world, perched at 10,000 feet altitude.

ziro-valley.name: Ziro Valley
ziro-valley.summary: UNESCO World Heritage tentative site, home to the Apatani tribe and famous for its pine hills and rice fields.

bomdila-monastery.name: Bomdila Monastery
bomdila-monastery.summary: Beautiful Buddhist monastery offering panoramic views of the Himalayan landscape and Kameng valley.

sela-pass-lake.name: Sela Pass & Lake
sela-pass-lake.summary: High altitude mountain pass at 13,700 feet with a sacred lake, often frozen in winter months.

namdapha-national-park.name: Namdapha National Park
namdapha-national-park.summary: India's third largest national park, home to four big cat species and incredible biodiversity.

elephant-falls.name: Elephant Falls
elephant-falls.summary: Three-tiered waterfall near Shillong, one of the most popular tourist spots in Meghalaya.

umiam-lake.name: Umiam Lake
umiam-lake.summary: Scenic reservoir surrounded by hills, popular for water sports and picnics.

mawlynnong-village.name: Mawlynnong Village
mawlynnong-village.summary: Asia's cleanest village, known for its cleanliness, living root bridges and matrilineal society.

nongriat-village.name: Nongriat Village
nongriat-village.summary: Home to the famous double-decker living root bridge, accessible via a trek of 3500 steps.

balpakram-national-park.name: Balpakram National Park
balpakram-national-park.summary: Known as the 'Land of Spirits' by the Garo tribe, featuring unique canyon formations.
